item.title: Jamie Dimon isn’t taking a recession off the table for 2026: ‘You don’t wish it because certain people will get hurt’
item.description: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon says a U.S. recession could hit in 2026, a warning to markets not to get complacent despite strong GDP growth and AI optimism

item.title: Gold’s price record is driven by the ‘debasement trade,’ China, and fear of an AI bubble, analysts say
item.description: Gold surged over $4,000/oz, up 50% this year, driven by investor fears over government debt, a weaker dollar, a buying spree by China’s central bank, ...

item.title: OpenAI dreams of Apple
item.description: OpenAI’s DevDay, held Monday at San Francisco’s historic Fort Mason, was exceptionally Apple-coded.

item.title: ‘Big Short’ investor Steve Eisman warns the U.S. economy is a ‘tale of two cities’ that ‘is not even growing 50 basis points outside of AI’
item.description: Eisman said if you erase AI infrastructure spending from projected U.S. GDP growth for 2025, the economic picture exposes a struggling consumer.

item.title: Multimillionaire serial entrepreneur cried the first time she made ‘real money’—but not in a good way: ‘Wealth doesn’t erase your problems. It magnifies them’
item.description: Emily Lyons said commas in her bank account didn’t help her feel relieved, but rather scared of losing all she had gained.
